content:
Port should be 587. Connection security should be STARTTLS. User name should be the whole e-mail address. Authentication method should be normal password.

And you must use an app-specific password from Apple instead of your regular password. Are you using one?

content:
1. Change the default setting to unthreaded for new folders in Settings > Appearance.
  2. Change one of the existing folders in View > Sort by > Unthreaded.
  3. Copy that setting to other existing folders by clicking on the icon on the far right of the column headings in table view and choosing "Copy current view to".
creator: mozilla98

content: If you want to change the password for an email account, you need to do that at the email provider's website.
creator: davidsk

content:
I don't understand your question. If you're trying to change your Mozilla account password, here is an article telling you how.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/how-change-or-reset-your-mozilla-account-password

If you are trying to change the password for your email account, you can't do that from within Thunderbird - you have to go to your email provider's web site to do that. You can then, knowing your new password, change the stored password within Thunderbird to agree with it. Here's an article describing how to edit saved passwords:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/password-manager-remember-delete-change-tb

If you need more help, please be more specific as to what your intention is and we can give you some more details. If you're looking to change your email password, tell us what version of Thunderbird you're using, what your operating system is, and who your email provider is.
creator: rednoise

content: Sorry, each installation is independent of other installations. Your best solution is to change passwords for the accounts.
creator: davidsk
